name: DHL Customs Duty Scam
description: Scammer impersonates DHL Express claiming an international package is held at customs and requires payment of customs duty, then extracts UPI ID and directs victim to a phishing payment page.

turns.scammer_message: DHL Express: Your international package from UK (Tracking: DHL78901234IN) is held at customs. Payment of Rs 3,500 customs duty required within 24 hours or package will be returned.
turns.notes: Initial bait message impersonating DHL with customs duty payment demand.

turns.scammer_message: Dear customer, to release your package DHL78901234IN from Indian customs, please pay the duty of Rs 3,500 via our secure payment portal: http://dhl-customs-clearance.co/pay — You can pay using credit card, debit card or net banking.
turns.notes: Scammer shares phishing link disguised as DHL payment portal.

turns.scammer_message: For faster clearance, you can also pay the customs duty directly via UPI. Send Rs 3,500 to our official DHL India customs UPI: dhl.customs.india@oksbi — Your package will be dispatched for delivery within 4 hours of payment confirmation.
turns.notes: Scammer reveals UPI ID as alternative payment method.

turns.scammer_message: If you need any assistance with the customs clearance process, please call our DHL India customer support at +91-7890123456. Our agents can also process the payment over the phone. Package return process starts in 6 hours.
turns.notes: Scammer provides fake phone number and adds time pressure.

turns.scammer_message: FINAL NOTICE: Your package DHL78901234IN will be RETURNED TO SENDER in 2 hours if customs duty of Rs 3,500 is not paid. Pay now at http://dhl-customs-clearance.co/pay or UPI: dhl.customs.india@oksbi or call +91-7890123456. No further extensions possible.
turns.notes: Final urgency message repeating all fake data with return-to-sender threat.
